I have been thinking about this for a while, and with the new SRBs in the ARM update, I think this would make sense.

There would also be the SRB nozzles as well.

A separate solid fuel tank idea doesn't make much sense.. it's a solid, how can it transfer between tanks? I know this is a game and you can just set the resource flow mode to STACK_PRIORITY_SEARCH and transfer to PUMP, but you'd be making it do things that are impossible in real life. I know that most things in KSP are impossible in real life (and vice versa) but at a basic level, it has some degree of realism. Making a solid fuel transferable from a separate fuel tank is not something that's vaguely realistic. It's exactly the same if the solid fuel was wood - how would you get the wood from tank A into tank B? It just doesn't work..

It's completely possible with some cfg editing though. As I said, make solid fuel transferable and so that it searches the stack (exactly like liquid fuel) or ALL_VESSEL (like electric charge or the old monoprop) or STAGE_PRIORITY_FLOW (like the new monoprop) or whatever you want and make up a few tanks which contain the RESCOURCE - SolidFuel.
Indeed, solid fuel doesn't floaw at all.
Unless you consider solid fuel tanks stacked on top of each other to be one tank.

This doesn't make sense UNLESS inline solid fuel can all count as "one" rocket. But that's a stretch.

Current SRB'S could just vary more.

But building your own SRB isn't realistic or practical.
Why not? It could be considered that you "design" the SRB and the manufacturer builds it to your design specifications.
An SRB system with a nozzle part and stackable propellant segments mounted inline above it would make a flexible, tunable booster. Sounds interesting to me.

technically, this is how the shuttle SRBs were designed, segments of solid fuel all stacked on top of a nozzle, I don't think it was ever done in the Shuttle program, but they could be custom built with different amounts of segments. I think this idea would be awesome, TBH, it's more realistic then StretchySRBs. We'd just have to figure out how to set them to only crossfeed when stacked to another solid fuel segment or a nozzle.

I would like to see this. Specifically, I would like the ability to customize solid fuel stages by choosing the number (and/or size) of tank segments attached to the nozzle.

Under the current system, we can design our own liquid fueled rocket stages, but are limited to prepackaged boosters. Neither realism nor gameplay justifies that limitation.

-TC
